intro: Lotononis laxa var. multiflora, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a compact, bushy habit with narrow, linear leaves. It produces numerous small flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The species is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
